name: Helden der Volksmusik
body:
### Introduction
This document specifies how to interact with the Helden der Volksmusik platform, including how to request resources, authenticate and how to post data to the backend. All operations against the platform are done against a RESTful API and all resources are accessible via HTTPS only.

### Conventions
- Unless expressed otherwise, all dates are expressed in number of milliseconds since January 1st, 1970 in GMT.
- Authentication and session preservation is handled by session cookies. Every HTTP request to the site will deliver you a session cookie. Make sure to attach this cookies to all your HTTP requests.
- All POST, PUT and DELETE HTTP operations (verbs) will require you to submit a csrf token. Use the endpoint `/token` to get one programatically. If you fail to submit a csrf token with these HTTP verbs, or submit an invalid one, you will receive an HTTP 500 error with data payload `EBADCSRFTOKEN`. If you get this error, we recommend you to get a csrf token by calling the `/token` endpoint and retry the operation.
- The preferred way to submit a csrf token with your request is to attach it to the url via que URL query `_csrf=`. You can also add it as a cookies with the name `x-csrf-token`.
- Some endpoints share the same url as some webpages. Therefore, in order to guarantee that you will received data (instead of an HTML response), we advise you to add the HTTP header `X-Requested-With: XMLHTTPRequest`to every request.
- The media endpoints that store video and audio files support streaming. When calling these files, expect to receive partial content responses (HTTP 206). That is, it is safe to start playback of such files immediately after your media player has buffered enough data.
- This documentation describes the data models (resources) and the properties that pertain to them. You may receive response with additional properties to the ones listed here. We discourage you to create a dependency on properties received within the object but not documented here, as we might rename or remove them from the object model in future releases.

## Resources
### Post
The post is the core of the platform and represents content uploaded by artists themselves.

Property | Description
-------- | -----------
content | String. Main content text of the post
date_published | Int64. Date, expressed in milliseconds, when the post was created
liked_by | Array. List of userIds that have liked this post
comments | Array. List of comment objects that have been written for this post. See Comment resource for details
title | String. Title of the post, usually the title of the song
likesCount | Int. Number of times the post has been liked.
commentsCount | Int. Number of times the post has been commented.
viewsCount | total number of times the post has been viewed.
media | JSON. Information about the media assets associated with this post. See Media object for information
styles | Array. Music genre category of this post, as provided by the artist. Can be null or empty
category | String. Category assigned to this post, as provided by the artist. Can be null or empty
**cuid** | **String. This is the main, unique identifier of the post**
authorId | String. Unique userId of the author of the post
isHitParadeEligible | Boolean. Specifies whether this post is participating in the hit parade or not
isEncoded | Boolean. If true, it means the main media asset of this post has already been processed by our encoding service and it is safe to stream it. If false, it means our encoding service has not yet optimised this video for web streaming, and thus this post should not be displayed to the user
id | in disuse
author | JSON. User object with information about the author of the post. See User resource description for details.

_Sample:_
```
{
    "content": "Text: saBINE\r\nMusik: Walter Pöham, saBINE",
    "date_published": 1441985224671,
    "liked_by": [
        {
            "userId": "ci4inrrhf0006owoi6if1jr17"
        },
        {
            "userId": "ci6sb0keo0000k0nehn5g8w3o"
        },
        {
            "userId": "ci7vlvtfa0001qwnygiiok4li"
        },
        {
            "userId": "ci8jw7fef0000fgniese3cekv"
        },
        {
            "userId": "ci8ketimi000jdcni8lpbpy86"
        }
    ],
    "comments": [
        {
            "postId": "ciefsrs9r0000twnm1zv9a9uc",
            "commentId": "ciehbe6nc00030onme9pz88if",
            "author": {
                "userId": "ci8ketimi000jdcni8lpbpy86",
                "displayName": "Richard Dregennus",
                "city": "wehr",
                "country": "Deutschland",
                "role": "fan",
                "dateCreated": 1429203428612,
                "canopyPicture": null,
                "selfie": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/profiles/noProfilePic.png",
                "identityProvider": "local",
                "facebookOptIn": false,
                "points": 0,
                "givenName": "Richard",
                "lastName": "Dregennus"
            },
            "content": "sehr scheens Liadl",
            "datePublished": 1442076969000
        }
    ],
    "title": "Musik aus Österreich",
    "likesCount": 5,
    "commentsCount": 1,
    "viewsCount": 44,
    "media": {
        "uri": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e_encoded.mp4",
        "contentType": "video/mp4",
        "poster": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e.jpg",
        "mp3": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e.mp3",
        "webm": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e_encoded.webm"
    },
    "styles": [
        "volkstümliche musik"
    ],
    "category": "video",
    "cuid": "ciefsrs9r0000twnm1zv9a9uc",
    "authorId": "ci8jw7fef0000fgniese3cekv",
    "isHitParadeEligible": true,
    "isEncoded": true,
    "id": "9d0141f0-6563-0bdb-a1f3-636e6261a8a2",
    "_rid": "fMA4AKk8BgAzAQAAAAAAAA==",
    "_ts": 1442677373,
    "_self": "dbs/fMA4AA==/colls/fMA4AKk8BgA=/docs/fMA4AKk8BgAzAQAAAAAAAA==/",
    "_etag": "\"00000500-0000-0000-0000-55fd827d0000\"",
    "_attachments": "attachments/",
    "author": {
        "userId": "ci8jw7fef0000fgniese3cekv",
        "displayName": "saBINE",
        "city": "Oberösterreich",
        "country": "Österreich",
        "role": "artist",
        "dateCreated": 1429172165008,
        "isEmailConfirmed": true,
        "canopyPicture": null,
        "selfie": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/profiles/cid0t8ib0000efso0akmlpjhd.png",
        "identityProvider": "local",
        "facebookOptIn": false,
        "points": 0,
        "members": 1,
        "styles": [
            "Volkstümlicher Schlager"
        ],
        "creatorName": "Sabine",
    }
}
```
    
### User
Provides information about a user

Property | Description
-------- | -----------
userId | String. Unique ID of the user object in the platform
displayName | String. Name to be used as display string. We encourage you to use this value, instead of concatenating properties to build the name yourself
city | String. Name of the user's city
country | String. Name of the user's country
role | String. Specifies where the user is an artist or a fan
dateCreated | Int64. Date, in milliseconds, when the user registered in the platform
canopyPicture | String. Absolute uri of the user's canopy picture
selfie | String. Absolute uri of the user's profile picture
identityProvider | String. If the value is `local`, it means the user has registered with own email address and password. Otherwise, specifies the social network with which the user registered (for example, Facebook)
identityProviderId | String. If the user registered via a social network, this property specifies the unique userId provided by the social network for the Helden app
points | Int. Specifies the number of points the user has accumulated in the platform
givenName | String. Given name of the user
lastName | String. Last name (family name) of the user

```
_Sample_:
{
    "userId": "ci8ketimi000jdcni8lpbpy86",
    "displayName": "RichardDregennus",
    "city": "wehr",
    "country": "Deutschland",
    "role": "fan",
    "dateCreated": 1429203428612,
    "canopyPicture": null,
    "selfie": "https: //az726827.vo.msecnd.net/profiles/noProfilePic.png",
    "identityProvider": "local",
    "points": 0,
    "givenName": "Richard",
    "lastName": "Dregennus"
}
```

### Comment
The comment object contains information about a comment given out by a user or artist to an existing post. Comments will always be attached to a post.  

Property | Description
-------- | -----------
postId | String. Unique ID of the post object for which this comment was written
commentId | String. Unique ID for the comment
author | JSON. Information about the user that wrote the comment
content | String. The actual content of the comment
datePublished | Int64. Date, in milliseconds, when the comment was submitted

Example:

```
{
    "postId": "ci8kbrnoz0001dcnig3cqlr36",
    "commentId": "ci8kf0uks000ldcni17vyr9sf",
    "author": {
        "userId": "ci8ketimi000jdcni8lpbpy86",
        "displayName": "Richard Dregennus",
        "city": "wehr",
        "country": "Deutschland",
        "role": "fan",
        "dateCreated": 1429203428612,
        "canopyPicture": null,
        "selfie": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/profiles/noProfilePic.png",
        "identityProvider": "local",
        "facebookOptIn": false,
        "points": 0,
        "givenName": "Richard",
        "lastName": "Dregennus"
    },
    "content": "a gelungene CD.",
    "datePublished": 1429203769804
}
```

### Media
The media object contains information about the media assets associated with a post.

Property | Description
-------- | -----------
uri | String. Absolute uri to the file that contains the main media of the post
contentType | String. Specifies the MIME type of the `uri` asset
poster | String. Absolute uri of the poster (image) file. A poster is a screenshot from a frame of a video. Can be null.
webm | String. Absolute uri of the file that contains the webm version of this video. Can be null or empty string.
mp3 | String. Absolute uri of the audio file for this post. Can be null or empty string. This applies to video and audio posts.

_Example_:

```
{
    "uri": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e_encoded.mp4",
    "contentType": "video/mp4",
    "poster": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e.jpg",
    "mp3": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e.mp3",
    "webm": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/creatives/a586d5fb3a237e41633a65f8311209f8ef6e_encoded.webm"
}
```

### Concert
Provides information about an artist's concert

Property | Description
-------- | -----------
author | JSON. User information about the artist that submitted this concert
media | in disuse
beginTimeShort | String. Hour of the day, in hh:mm format, when the concert starts
currency | String. Currency to be used when displaying the price of the concert
dateInMs | Int64. Date, in milliseconds, when the concert will take place (day, month and year, defaults to 00:00 hours GMT)
openTimeShort | String. Hour, in hh:mm format, when the concert venue will be opened for the concert
price | Int(double). Price of the concert's ticket. If the artist specified a price with decimals, you will receive a Double value
street | String. Street address of the concert venue
venue | String. Name of the concert venue
zipCode | String. Postal code of the city where the concert will take place. Takes the format xx-####, where xx can be "D" or "DE", "AT" or "CH"
artistId | String. Unique ID of the artist that submitted the concert
**id** | **String. Unique ID of the concert's object**
blobId | String. Absolute uri of the poster image of the concert. Can be null
uploadToStore | Boolean. If true, it means that tickets for the concert are available for sell in the Helden der Volksmusik store

Example:
```
{
    "author": {
        "userId": "ci4inrrhf0006owoi6if1jr17",
        "displayName": "Hilander",
        "city": "Feldkirch",
        "country": "Österreich",
        "role": "artist",
        "dateCreated": "1420390400739",
        "canopyPicture": null,
        "selfie": "https://az726827.vo.msecnd.net/profiles/ciaqrinzw0001a4nwrodicsp3.png",
        "identityProvider": "local",
        "points": 400,
        "members": 2,
        "styles": [
            "Volkstümliche Musik"
        ],
    },
    "media": {
        "streamingEndpoint": null
    },
    "beginTimeShort": "20:30",
    "currency": "EUR",
    "dateInMs": 1443218400000,
    "openTimeShort": "18:00",
    "price": 20,
    "street": "Schlossangerstrasse 2",
    "venue": "Gasthof Ismair, Türnthenning",
    "zipCode": "D-84164",
    "artistId": "ci4inrrhf0006owoi6if1jr17",
    "id": "d8c70fb0-a395-4ea4-70ab-bb32758de79f",
    "blobId": null,
    "uploadToStore": false
}
```

## Endpoints
### GET /post?continuation_token=[token]
_Requires authentication: No_
Return Array of Post objects
This endpoint will return up to 5 Posts, order from newest to oldest (as specified in the property `date_published`. In order to assemble a series of posts chronologically, you should store the value of `date_published` for the last post received in a response (the oldest post) and use this value in the query parameter `continuation_token` to retrieve the next 5 older posts.

Parameter | Description
-------- | -----------
continuation_token | Date in milliseconds. If submitted, the API will return the next 5 posts older than the value of `continuation_token`

_Sample reply:_
```

                "Volksmusik",
                "Volkstümliche Musik",
                "Volkstümlicher Schlager"
            ],
            "creatorName": "Willy Vogel",
        }
    }
]
```

### GET /post/[postId]
Returns a Post JSON object for the requested `:postId`.

Parameter | Description
-------- | -----------
postId | Unique ID of the post to be requested. This corresponds to the value of property `cuid` of the post object.

### GET /post/random
Returns a random Post object
This endpoint is particularly useful for the radio feature on the iPhone app, as the radio offers the user playback of random songs. Use this endpoint to get a random Post from our entire catalog

### GET /post/[postId]/comments/
Returns an array with all comments that belong to a specific post. See Comment object model for further details

Parameter | Description
-------- | -----------
postId | Unique ID of the post to be requested. This corresponds to the value of property `cuid` of the post object.

Sample response:

```
[
    {
        "postId": "ci8kbrnoz0001dcnig3cqlr36",
        "commentId": "ci8kf0uks000ldcni17vyr9sf",
        "author": {
            "userId": "ci8ketimi000jdcni8lpbpy86",

```

### GET /ranking
Returns a JSON literal with information about the top posts of the month for our hit parade. The hit parade is divided into the following rankings:
- Hit Parade: includes the video most liked by the community
- Most commented: the most commented videos for the month
- Most views: the most viewed posts for the month

Example

```

### GET /post/[postId]/likes
Returns an array with all likes that belong to a specific post. 

Parameter | Description
-------- | -----------
postId | Unique ID of the post to be requested. This corresponds to the value of property `cuid` of the post object.

Sample response:
```
[
    {
        "userId": "ci2wxmpxh0000owmuxlevqnia",
        "displayName": "Hilander",
        "city": "Feldkrich",
        "country": "Österreich",

    {

        "displayName": "Luis Delgado",

### GET /concert
Returns an array of Concert objects, ordered based on property `dateInMs` (from the earliest one to the latest one). Currently, it does not provide pagination.

Sample:

### POST /user/artist
Use this endpoint to create a new artist in our database. This endpoint accepts a JSON literal with the following syntax:

```
{
    "creatorName": "Ruben Paredes",
    "email": "swing@latino.com",
    "displayName": "Swing Criollo",
    "members": 2,
    "country": "Argentinien",
    "city": "Buenos Aires",
    "managed": true,
    "recordManaged": true,
    "password": "123123123",
    "passwordRepeat": "123123123",
    "styles": [
        "Schlager",
        "Volksmusik"
    ]
}
```
Upon successful creation of an artist, the backend will consider your sessionId to be logged in. You do not need to ask the user for login after registration.

### POST /user/fan
Use this endpoint to create a new fan in our database. This endpoint accepts a JSON literal with the following syntax:

```
{
    "email": "ursula@meier.at",
    "givenName": "Ursula",
    "lastName": "Meier",
    "country": "Österreich",
    "city": "Feldkirch",
    "password": "123123123",
    "passwordRepeat": "123123123",
    "gender": "female"
}
```
Upon successful creation of a fan, the backend will consider your sessionId to be logged in. You do not need to ask the user for login after registration.

### GET /sas
**Requires authentication**
This endpoint will return a Shared Access Signature token. This token is required when posting media assets to our blob storage endpoint. These token has a validity of up to 15 minutes, so your application must control for expired tokens and request a new one if needed.

Example token
`"se=2015-09-20T23%3A07%3A53Z&sp=w&sv=2014-02-14&sr=c&sig=8SF5CMT5%2F5xRmIiDIF3J7q5LUx90gL9ftFPIMHQcXvw%3D"`

### GET /token
Retrieves a CSRF token. This endpoint will respond with a cookie named `x-csrf-token`. Store its value, as this is the corresponding csrf token for the sessionID with which you are connecting

### GET /search
This endpoint will deliver a read-only API Key for our search service. Use this API to perform a search on our search provider. If you do not provide this API key to the search provider, you will receive an HTTP 403 error. The data payload will contain the API key.

Sample key: `"C01512F72E1353042C8FEB33DB9E7929"`


Example
`Set-Cookie: x-csrf-token=rrJuk1Xp-mCCExnSHPIbVG1z5T5xjSwZIjms; path=/; httponly`
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
